content:
Hi all, I am Mahmut (vertexclique). Want to join to std simd endeavour, so opened this PR: https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/446
Apart from that, which frequency do you meet and what are the things on your roadmap?

Hi @vertexclique! Thanks for reaching out :wave: We don't have a set path to team membership just yet, but are meeting regularly ever 2 weeks. You can find when those happen on the Libs team calendar: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/embed?src=9kuu8evq4eh6uacm262k0phri8@group.calendar.google.com

As for what's on the roadmap, the current goal is to get an initial implementation of stdsimd ready to ship in nightly compilers. You can get a sense of where it's at from the open issues here: https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd/issues
Is there anything you'd like to help out with @vertexclique? We also have plans to write some broadly targeted SIMD docs

I can help with trait implementations that we can add to core_simd. Or maybe that's better to add that to some other crate under stdsimd/crates. Which will allow integrating with existing columnar representations that I am working with.
hm, I think we're meeting every 1 week atm because we have been having a lot going on, though it might become 2 weeks after this one.
at least, no one complained when we scheduled the last 2 meetings 1 week out. >_>
I would prefer 1/week, particularly if they're going to be shorter meetings.
